newsArray.title: Can play in front of millions, but was once ‚Äòpetrified‚Äô of the ocean
creator: Peter Ryan
newsArray.description: Pies stalwart Steele Sidebottom plays his 300th game on Sunday, and his close friends and teammates have shared their stories of a laid-back, fun-loving, competitive beast.
newsArray.content: Loading Collingwood‚Äôs Steele Sidebottom has never been one to pump himself up. Nor has he chased the limelight. But he could not resist interrupting his premiership skipper Nick Maxwell - who had joined the club as a rookie - during a pre-season session where the captain emphasised to the club‚Äôs recruits that regardless of what number pick they had been when they arrived, they were all equally entitled to play in round one. Collingwood‚Äôs Steele Sidebottom, who reaches 300 AFL games on Sunday, with the statue of Bob Rose. Credit: Getty Images Maxwell extolled the virtues of his rookie brethren, praising them for their persistence and resilience and making it pretty obvious he had a soft spot for footy‚Äôs battlers. The speech became all a bit rich for Sidebottom. ‚ÄúSorry for being a gun and kicking 10 in a granny,‚Äù Sidebottom suddenly blurted out. The room dissolved into laughter. Premiership player Steele Sidebottom is one of the constants between the 2010 and 2023 sides. Credit: Getty Images That bag of 10 for the Murray Bushrangers in the 2008 TAC Cup grand final ensured he was a first-round pick, Collingwood using selection 11 to make him a Magpie. It was the first thing his new teammates heard about him. Soon enough, however, they were talking about his constant smile, his skills on both sides of his body and his clean hands, and his competitiveness. ‚ÄúHe is realistically one of the most competitive people I have ever met,‚Äù said Jarryd Blair, the former Pie who also joined the club as a rookie, and who remains one of Sidebottom‚Äôs great mates. His friend Sam Muggleton told The Age that Sidebottom had been ‚Äúa gun‚Äù from the moment they first played together as primary school children in a combined team from Shepparton. Celebrate if you‚Äôve kicked 10 goals in a TAC Cup grand final: Steele Sidebottom can. Credit: Getty Images At Sidebottom‚Äôs wedding in 2022, Muggleton recalled in his speech a bloke with a rat‚Äôs tail rocking up to training for that team late in the piece and being picked immediately. Their first game was tight before Sidebottom stepped up to kick one goal with his left foot from the right forward pocket, and then the winning goal with his right foot from the left forward pocket. He had learned to kick on both feet because he idolised his older brother Tyson - who he cheekily described on Wednesday as the favourite of his four older brothers - who was proficient on both feet. Sidebottom spent hours booting a footy into the back fence, alternating feet to keep it interesting. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve always had some kind of ball in my hand. I played touch footy, soccer, cricket, tennis, whatever it is,‚Äù Sidebottom said. The endurance beast Another of his mates from around Shepparton, Michael Morey, knew his friend‚Äôs ball skills were good, but it wasn‚Äôt until they were in their teens he realised he had other athletic attributes. The pair had faced off in Morey‚Äôs family orchard with three small apples in their hands to ping at each other. Morey moved first, but each throw missed. He had to run. Loading Soon after he took off, he felt Sidebottom‚Äôs breath on his neck despite the fact he was sprinting to get away. ‚ÄúHe just slowly sat behind me for the next 500 metres and as soon as I started puffing a little bit, bang, apple in the back of the head. He got all three into me and I remember thinking, ‚ÄòThis guy can run‚Äô,‚Äù Morey said. Close to 20 years after that horseplay revealed his tank, Sidebottom is still covering more ground during matches than all but one or two of his teammates, reaching ‚Äúanywhere from 13 to 15 [kilometres] a game‚Äù. Blair, his premiership teammate who arrived at the club a month after Sidebottom, said his endurance had set him apart from his peers. He remembered Sidebottom revealing to him at the start of their second season that he had gone for one five-kilometre run in the off-season as he felt guilty after a few consecutive days spent socialising. Steele Sidebottom and Jarryd Blair were front and centre in the 2010 premiership team. which contained eight players who started their careers on a rookie list. Credit: Paul Rovere ‚ÄúHe then won the 2k time trial in about 6:05 minutes,‚Äù Blair said. Blair said it‚Äôs one thing to have the endurance Sidebottom possessed but another to push the body to extremes to empty the tank. A competitive animal That will to always push harder came from an innate competitiveness that Blair has seen hilariously play out time after time, on and off the field. In their first year, the pair and another rookie, Tristan Francis, settled down for a game of cricket in the courtyard of their house in Williamstown. Three hours later, with Sidebottom still batting, his mates had had enough and went inside. ‚ÄúHe just straight batted it back like it was the fifth day of a Test match, and he was just trying to hang on,‚Äù Blair said. Loading That stubborn competitiveness is combined with a constant smile that his former coach Nathan Buckley calls the ‚Äúopposite of a resting bitch face‚Äù. The battles on the golf course between him and Jeremy Howe - two friends whose laid-back demeanour masks their desire to win - are famous at the club. ‚ÄúWhether it‚Äôs golf, table tennis, tennis, goal kicking, or an argument there is minimal chance you‚Äôre going to beat him with his relentless competitive drive,‚Äù Howe said. ‚ÄúBeing one of four brothers will create that within, I guess.‚Äù The smile is not just a facade. Sidebottom loves playing all sport, particularly football, and hanging out with his mates, his wife Alisha Edwards, who is a lawyer, and their daughter Matilda. His down-to-earth nature means 100 friends and family will be at Marvel Stadium on Sunday to watch him reach his milestone300th game, including his mum Linda, who Sidebottom bought a house for when his career took off to show his appreciation for her efforts raising five boys . ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs still the same old Steele he was when I met him 15-20 years ago,‚Äù Morey said. Muggleton laughs at his friend‚Äôs competitiveness, saying they often end some sort of sporting battle with a beer, unable to talk to each other about what transpired as one of them will still be seething. Left or right foot, it never mattered to Steele Sidebottom. Credit: Getty Images The pair played football together at Congupna, where Muggleton, a year older, was captain. Such was Sidebottom‚Äôs love of the club, which carries the nickname, ‚Äúthe Road‚Äù, he ended his Hotmail at one stage with ‚ÄúRoaders‚Äù. He might appear a country boy through and through, but he hasn‚Äôt fooled Muggleton. Loading ‚ÄúHe is scared of everything,‚Äù Muggleton said. He remembers taking Sidebottom fishing with his former teammate Adam Oxley, and Sidebottom yelling at them to pick up a fish that had dropped off the line after being caught. Muggleton finally said, ‚ÄúYou do it‚Äù, and watched Sidebottom retreat like a defeated army. ‚ÄúHe said, ‚ÄòNo way‚Äô,‚Äù Muggleton recalled. Blair adds that his mate was ‚Äúgenuinely petrified‚Äù of the ocean when he first moved to the club, never moving beyond his waist. He then taught himself to swim better. Such fears do not translate to the middle of the MCG, with Blair simply describing his friend‚Äôs record in big games as ‚Äúunreal‚Äù. Let me entertain you During his 299 matches, Sidebottom has played in front of 15,083,531 fans, with only teammate Scott Pendlebury and Essendon‚Äôs Dustin Fletcher showing their skills to more spectators. He won a flag in his second year, was runner-up in the Norm Smith Medal in the grand final replay behind Pendlebury, and after battling a bruised heel for several seasons midway through his career became a star during 2017 and 2018, earning All-Australian selection in 2018, was runner-up in a Brownlow Medal and became a dual Copeland Trophy winner. His 41-touch performance in the 2018 preliminary final is often forgotten due to Mason Cox‚Äôs heroics . He also won the 2016 Anzac Day Medal. He has been trouble free, apart from his COVID-19 breach in 2020 after a few drinks got out of hand. He served a four-game suspension and probably dashed any hopes he would replace Pendlebury as captain. Buckley, who was coach at the time, has enormous respect for him, as do all his teammates, with Sidebottom‚Äôs sense of humour often a ballast during difficult times at the club. ‚ÄúSteele keeps life relatively simple and then makes the difficult look ridiculously easy. He just loves being a part of the club and around the boys. He is just a balanced guy,‚Äù Buckley said. Blair played 144 games alongside Sidebottom, and knows his consistency is due to more than natural talent. Sidebottom said it would be wrong to say he is enjoying football more than ever under Craig McRae because he has always enjoyed it. Credit: Getty Images ‚ÄúHe has a deep level of care for what he is doing and pride in his performance. He has obviously always been a high achiever in sports and carried that through with him the whole way. His desperation to win has always been evident and cool to see and be a part of,‚Äù Blair said. He said his quiet leadership and the direction he has guided the club in should not be underestimated, either. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs not a confrontational person, but he has got a strong sense of right from wrong, and he is pretty comfortable in sticking to what he believes is right and the best thing for him and everyone at the club,‚Äù Blair said. Now, as just the fourth Magpie and the 101st player ever to reach 300 games, he is already confirmed as a club great. Not that anyone would recognise his status in the game if they bumped into him having a quiet beer with his mates, which is where he seems most comfortable. Magpies skipper Darcy Moore says his influence has been profound on and off the field. ‚ÄúHe is such a great teammate, so passionate and such a larrikin. He just never takes anything too seriously. He is always making jokes, and he is a really popular guy,‚Äù Moore said. But there is one thing Sidebottom is taking seriously, and that is Collingwood‚Äôs tilt at another premiership. Amid all the enjoyment, his focus on achieving that goal is at an all-time high. Keep up to date with the best AFL coverage in the country. Sign up for the Real Footy newsletter . Save Log in , register or subscribe to save articles for later. License this article AFL 2023 For subscribers Collingwood Magpies Peter Ryan is a sports reporter with The Age. newsArray.title: What Happens If IPL Final 2023 Between Gujarat Titans and Chennai Super Kings Gets Washed Out Due to Rain?
creator: admin
newsArray.description: Home Sports What Happens If IPL Final 2023 Between Gujarat Titans and Chennai Super Kings Gets Washed Out Due to Rain? The stage is all set for an epic clash as Gujarat are on the verge of becoming the first side after Chennai to retain the title in consecutive years. Chennai on the other hand [‚Ä¶] The post What Happens If IPL Final 2023 Between Gujarat Titans and Chennai Super Kings Gets Washed Out Due to Rain? first appeared on The Times of Bengal.
newsArray.content: New Delhi: Chennai Super Kings lock horns with defending champions Gujarat Titans in the 16th final of the Indian Premier League on Sunday at the Narendra Stadium in Ahmedabad. Rumours are also peaking high at the same time that this blockbuster finale will mark the end of CSK captain MS Dhoni‚Äôs cricketing career. The stage is all set for an epic clash as Gujarat are on the verge of becoming the first side after Chennai to retain the title in consecutive years. Chennai on the other hand will be fighting for Dhoni and make it equal with Mumbai on most trophies won. But what happens if the IPL Final gets washed out due to rain ? Even though there are less chances of rain in Ahmedabad and if not a single ball is bowled due to the harsh weather conditions, then one with the highest position in the table will run away with the trophy. In the case, Gujarat Titans will claim a second successive title as they topped the league phase ahead of Chennai Super Kings. A minimum of 5 overs need to be bowled for a match to take place. If the match gets stopped in between the play then quite obviously Duckworth-Lewis (DLS) method will come into play to determine the winner. Gujarat Titans Squad: Wriddhiman Saha(w), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya(c), Vijay Shankar, David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Mohit Sharma, Noor Ahmad, Mohammed Shami, Joshua Little, Srikar Bharat, Shivam Mavi, Odean Smith, Ravisrinivasan Sai Kishore, Pradeep Sangwan, Matthew Wade, Jayant Yadav, Dasun Shanaka, Abhinav Manohar, Alzarri Joseph, Darshan Nalkande, Urvil Patel, Yash Dayal. Chennai Super Kings Squad: Ruturaj Gaikwad, Devon Conway, Shivam Dube, Ajinkya Rahane, Ambati Rayudu, MS Dhoni(w/c), Ravindra Jadeja, Moeen Ali, Deepak Chahar, Tushar Deshpande, Maheesh Theekshana, Matheesha Pathirana, Mitchell Santner, Subhranshu Senapati, Shaik Rasheed, Akash Singh, Ben Stokes, Dwaine Pretorius, Sisanda Magala, Ajay Jadav Mandal, Prashant Solanki, Simarjeet Singh, RS Hangargekar, Bhagath Varma, Nishant Sindhu. $(document).ready(function(){ $('#commentbtn').on("click",function(){ (function(d, s, id) { var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0]; if (d.getElementById(id)) return; js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id; js.src = "https://connect.facebook.net/en_US/all.js#xfbml=1&appId=178196885542208"; fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs); }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk')); $(".cmntbox").toggle(); }); }); Source link

newsArray.title: Bayern sack CEO Oliver Kahn, sports director Hasan Salihamidzic after title win-club
newsArray.content: Bayern Munich have parted ways with club CEO Oliver Kahn and Hasan Salihamidzic only minutes after they snatched their 11th straight Bundesliga title on the last matchday on Saturday, the club said. Kahn, who took over the position in 2021 succeeding Karl-Heinz Rummenigge, will be replaced by Jan-Christian Dreesen with immediate effect, the club said in a statement. ‚ÄúIt was a difficult decision to part ways with Oliver but we came to the conclusion that based on the overall development a restaffing of the top position in the board,‚Äù Bayern said. Bayern beat Cologne 2-1 thanks to an 89th minute winner from Jamal Musiala and benefited from Borussia Dortmund‚Äôs 2-2 draw to win the title on goal difference. newsArray.title: IPL 2023: Chennai Super Kings better prepared for IPL final compared to past, says Stephen Fleming
newsArray.content: Chennai Super Kings head coach Stephen Fleming on Saturday said that the four-time winners are better prepared for the IPL final against Gujarat Titans than any other time in the past, when conditions affected their performance. Fleming said CSK‚Äôs win-loss ratio remained around 50 per cent because they would usually build and prepare their squads keeping the conditions and pitches at the home venue at Chepauk in mind, but that is not the case anymore. He said the team would be ready for any conditions ‚Äî there are rains expected during the final here on Sunday ‚Äî and that they have erred in reading conditions and pitches in the past. ‚ÄúWe geared ourselves up so well for Chennai that we did struggle with conditions at times in away games, so the finals were always a little bit of a challenge, and our record is about 50 per cent of winning the final,‚Äù Fleming said during the pre-match press conference. ‚ÄúIt is maybe due to the style of the game we created ‚Äî a victim of being so good at home that we had to make adjustments when we went to a neutral venue.‚Äù Fleming said CSK were ‚Äúa bit more rounded‚Äù this year. ‚ÄúBecause of that going back to Chennai (for Qualifier 1), it was hard. I wanted to bowl (first) in the last qualifying game and batting proved to be the right call and MS (Dhoni) was the other way in the last game,‚Äù he said. Anbuden ‚û°Ô∏è Ahmedabad with a million whistles! ü•≥ #GTvCSK #WhistlePodu #Yellove ü¶Åüíõ pic.twitter.com/Tyjhxd1Nsf ‚Äî Chennai Super Kings (@ChennaiIPL) May 23, 2023 https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js ‚ÄúSo we are well off the mark in trying to get the conditions right but the team is rounded enough to put performances together. Come the final, we are not worried as to what conditions we get, there are two pitches to choose from now but we are not too worried. We are a lot better placed than what we had been in the past,‚Äù he said. Advertisement The former New Zealand captain said that making early breakthroughs will be key for his side as GT batter Shubman Gill‚Äôs red-hot form presents the biggest challenge for CSK. ‚ÄúHe (Gill) is playing really well. It (the plans) does not really change, you hope that you pick him up early, you have enough firepower to create an opportunity. The only thing that we are looking at is when you have got openers, when they are in such good form, there is an opportunity to get into the middle order. Advertisement ‚ÄúIf we can get a couple of early breakthroughs then, (just like) in the last game we played there is an opportunity. But we got to get past him, he is playing really well,‚Äù Fleming said. For someone who has won IPL title four times with CSK, Fleming said it is not easy winning the trophy back-to-back. ‚ÄúSo hard! It is impossible, it is going to be so hard for them (GT) to do it (laughs). No, they are a good side; you got to say ‚Äòreally well done‚Äô to what they have put together in a short space of time,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI like the coaching staff a lot, they are really balanced guys. Ashish, for all his talking, has got a really good grasp of the game, his enthusiasm is really high after working with him in Chennai. We have a huge amount of respect for what they have done but it is very hard to go back to back.‚Äù Gujarat Titans ‚Äô team director Vikram Solanki also returned the favour, but added that knowledge of conditions in their ‚Äòhome ground‚Äô here should hold them in good stead. ‚ÄúWe are definitely better for the experience for having played here, having played in the final (last year) here, and having been successful in those big games. We are better for it,‚Äù he said. Caution: Wear helmets and watch Shivam drive! ü¶Åüí• #WhistlePodu #Yellove üíõ @IamShivamDube pic.twitter.com/dfdIK9fXLQ ‚Äî Chennai Super Kings (@ChennaiIPL) May 27, 2023 https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js Advertisement ‚ÄúWe entirely appreciate this sort of respect CSK have given. They have been a fabulous team for a good number of years now and we respect that. We are confident; what transpires on the day is what transpires on the day,‚Äù Solanki added. Solanki praised GT‚Äôs bowling trio of Mohammad Shami (28 wickets), Rashid Khan (27 wickets) and Mohit Sharma (24 wickets), who also are the top three wicket-takers in this IPL. Advertisement ‚ÄúIf you look at the tournament in its entirety, the impact player rule has had a bearing on the number of batsmen that are playing, therefore, wicket-taking becomes all the more important. We have always being attacking minded, an attack that is able to take wickets in different conditions through different phases of the game,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThat is our go-to, the ability to take wickets. All three have been quite brilliant this year, they have worked extremely hard and they deserve all the success that is coming their way.‚Äù The former England batter said at just 23, Gill could be an example for young batters to model their batting on. He would certainly be one of the examples that you would like to use for young players on how to bat,‚Äù Solanki said. Fortunately for us, he is in good form, he works very hard on his game, not just in practice. He is very conscious of the opposition that he is going to face, where he is likely to gain advantage, what are the dangers, what are the things that he is going to have to deal with.‚Äù

newsArray.title: ‚ÄúHello friend, we meet again‚Äù: Jasprit Bumrah hints at international cricket return
creator: ANI
newsArray.content: Indian pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah, who has been out of action for the last several months due to injury, seems to be on the path of a stunning comeback to the sport. The 29-year-old pacer posted a picture of his cricket shoes on his Instagram. ‚ÄúHello friend, we meet again,‚Äù said Bumrah‚Äôs post caption. https://www.instagram.com/p/CsvzrL-KHuq/?hl=en In April, Bumrah underwent surgery on his lower back in New Zealand. The medical procedure was successful and helped Bumrah get free from pain. ‚ÄúJasprit Bumrah underwent surgery on his lower back in New Zealand which was successful and he remains pain-free. The fast bowler was advised by the specialist to start his rehab six weeks after the surgery and accordingly, Bumrah commenced his rehab management at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru from Friday,‚Äù said a press release from BCCI on April 15. Bumrah is out of action since September 2022 owing to a back injury and as a result, missed the ICC Men‚Äôs T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. The ace pacer completed his rehabilitation at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru and has been seen bowling in the nets but BCCI has chosen not to rush him back into action. The pacer also missed Indian Premier League (2023), in which he represents Mumbai Indians. Though MI reached playoffs, their bowling attack looked extremely toothless without Bumrah‚Äôs presence on numerous occasions. While fans wait to see Bumrah back on the field with his unique bowling action, he has been unable to join the team due to a recurring injury. He has attempted to make a comeback more than once since suffering a back injury in August last year which ruled him out of the Asia Cup. Initially, the injury did not seem serious as he was named in India‚Äôs T20 World Cup squad in September and even played the last two T20Is against Australia on September 23 and September 25 last year. Three days later, Bumrah did not play the first T20I against South Africa and it was learnt that he was taken for scans, which revealed a stress-related injury in his back. He was rushed to NCA and the scans there confirmed that the injury was serious. It ruled him out of the T20 World Cup, in which India achieved a semifinal finish. Bumrah resumed his rehab in November and started to bowl in mid-December. His progress seemed to be positive as he was added to the white-ball series played in January against Sri Lanka more than a week after the original squad was picked up. Bumrah had performed the match simulation exercises in the NCA, but discomfort resurfaced while taking up higher workloads during fitness drills in January. Scans revealed the development of a fresh niggle, which ruled him out of the Sri Lanka series and Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia. (ANI)

newsArray.title: When Gautam Gambhir Kicked Chair in Frustration Post KKR Win vs RCB in IPL 2016
creator: Gurpreet Singh
newsArray.description: Be it in the capacity of a player or in his role as the mentor of Lucknow Super Giants at present, Gautam Gambhir has made sure to not shy away from displaying his raw emotions to the ever-ready cameras panning towards him. His temperature perhaps soars higher by a couple of notches whenever he is‚Ä¶ The post When Gautam Gambhir Kicked Chair in Frustration Post KKR Win vs RCB in IPL 2016 appeared first on The SportsRush.
newsArray.content: Be it in the capacity of a player or in his role as the mentor of at present, has made sure to not shy away from displaying his raw emotions to the ever-ready cameras panning towards him. Advertisement His temperature perhaps soars higher by a couple of notches whenever he is involved in an IPL fixture featuring former captain because of some past moments of uneasy tension between the two . During the 2016 edition of the coveted league, Gambhir had yet again indulged himself in an act which was not only unnecessary but had resultantly cost him 15% of match fee owing to unruly behavior. Advertisement En route a 186-run targetagainst RCB in Bengaluru, Gambhir-led had lost four wickets by the 11th over of the chase. However, the pair of (60*) and (39) nailed their respective power game to see their side home with five deliveries to spare. The moment (10*) smashed the winning boundary, a pumped-up Gambhir could not control his emotions and vented his frustration by kicking a chair placed in the dug out across the boundary rope. The southpaw batter, who was still with his pads on, was more than just excited with the way his team snatched victory from the jaws of defeat. Post kicking the chair, he perhaps also hurled a couple of expletives while looking at someone in the field of play. Loading embed instagram https://www.instagram.com/reel/CslGQYNNmrB/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading After being fined with the Level 1 breach of the IPL code of conduct, the KKR skipper did accept his mistake while realizing that he shouldn‚Äôt have kicked the chair. Advertisement However, he was later quoted as saying by that despite being a role model, he, too, is entitled to have emotions and feelings which get naturally displayed on the field of action. ‚ÄúMy brush with the authorities is not new. While I am repentant and embarrassed, I have never got the answer to one very basic question ‚Äì Aren‚Äôt role models entitled to have emotions? Aren‚Äôt they human enough to express themselves or release their pent-up feelings? I think they, too, are by-products of the times and the society they are living in.‚Äù Eyeing on his third IPL title, Gambhir did manage to take KKR through to the playoffs that season by finishing at the fourth spot on the points table post the league stage. However, Kolkata ended up losing to by 22 runs in the Eliminator to crash out of the tournament. Advertisement

newsArray.title: ‚ÄòHe tells everyone, please keep watching me‚Äô: S Badrinath reveals how MS Dhoni‚Äôs last moment field changes produce wickets
newsArray.content: Former Chennai Super Kings player Subramaniam Badrinath revealed how skipper Mahendra Singh Dhoni tends to make maneuvers in the last moment before every delivery and occasionally they end up producing wickets. Speaking on Star Sports, Badrinath said, ‚ÄúHe tells everyone, please keep watching me. Because that last minute adjustment, that two yard left or right could be the difference between a catch and a drop. It has happened many times.‚Äù ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs important that we keep tuned into the game, and try to remain involved. Every ball is an event, and we complete the event and move onto the next event. That‚Äôs how he addresses every ball. He assures the field is right, the bowler is right,‚Äù he added. In response to a query about Dhoni‚Äôs conversation with the team in the 2010 final Badrinath said, ‚ÄúEvery time there was a par total, and not so much of a par, he only said one thing; let‚Äôs try and save one run each.‚Äù ‚ÄúIf we save a run each, we can make the score 10 runs extra. That‚Äôs what was going to be the difference, because these were under our control. Wickets will happen, but the small things; if everybody is trying to save one run, the score becomes a little extra,‚Äù he added. newsArray.title: Can play in front of millions, but was once ‚Äòpetrified‚Äô of the ocean
creator: Peter Ryan
newsArray.description: Pies stalwart Steele Sidebottom plays his 300th game on Sunday, and his close friends and teammates have shared their stories of a laid-back, fun-loving, competitive beast.
newsArray.content: Loading Collingwood‚Äôs Steele Sidebottom has never been one to pump himself up. Nor has he chased the limelight. But he could not resist interrupting his premiership skipper Nick Maxwell - who had joined the club as a rookie - during a pre-season session where the captain emphasised to the club‚Äôs recruits that regardless of what number pick they had been when they arrived, they were all equally entitled to play in round one. Collingwood‚Äôs Steele Sidebottom, who reaches 300 AFL games on Sunday, with the statue of Bob Rose. Credit: Getty Images Maxwell extolled the virtues of his rookie brethren, praising them for their persistence and resilience and making it pretty obvious he had a soft spot for footy‚Äôs battlers. The speech became all a bit rich for Sidebottom. ‚ÄúSorry for being a gun and kicking 10 in a granny,‚Äù Sidebottom suddenly blurted out. The room dissolved into laughter. Premiership player Steele Sidebottom is one of the constants between the 2010 and 2023 sides. Credit: Getty Images That bag of 10 for the Murray Bushrangers in the 2008 TAC Cup grand final ensured he was a first-round pick, Collingwood using selection 11 to make him a Magpie. It was the first thing his new teammates heard about him. Soon enough, however, they were talking about his constant smile, his skills on both sides of his body and his clean hands, and his competitiveness. ‚ÄúHe is realistically one of the most competitive people I have ever met,‚Äù said Jarryd Blair, the former Pie who also joined the club as a rookie, and who remains one of Sidebottom‚Äôs great mates. His friend Sam Muggleton told The Age that Sidebottom had been ‚Äúa gun‚Äù from the moment they first played together as primary school children in a combined team from Shepparton. Celebrate if you‚Äôve kicked 10 goals in a TAC Cup grand final: Steele Sidebottom can. Credit: Getty Images At Sidebottom‚Äôs wedding in 2022, Muggleton recalled in his speech a bloke with a rat‚Äôs tail rocking up to training for that team late in the piece and being picked immediately. Their first game was tight before Sidebottom stepped up to kick one goal with his left foot from the right forward pocket, and then the winning goal with his right foot from the left forward pocket. He had learned to kick on both feet because he idolised his older brother Tyson - who he cheekily described on Wednesday as the favourite of his four older brothers - who was proficient on both feet. Sidebottom spent hours booting a footy into the back fence, alternating feet to keep it interesting. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve always had some kind of ball in my hand. I played touch footy, soccer, cricket, tennis, whatever it is,‚Äù Sidebottom said. The endurance beast Another of his mates from around Shepparton, Michael Morey, knew his friend‚Äôs ball skills were good, but it wasn‚Äôt until they were in their teens he realised he had other athletic attributes. The pair had faced off in Morey‚Äôs family orchard with three small apples in their hands to ping at each other. Morey moved first, but each throw missed. He had to run. Loading Soon after he took off, he felt Sidebottom‚Äôs breath on his neck despite the fact he was sprinting to get away. ‚ÄúHe just slowly sat behind me for the next 500 metres and as soon as I started puffing a little bit, bang, apple in the back of the head. He got all three into me and I remember thinking, ‚ÄòThis guy can run‚Äô,‚Äù Morey said. Close to 20 years after that horseplay revealed his tank, Sidebottom is still covering more ground during matches than all but one or two of his teammates, reaching ‚Äúanywhere from 13 to 15 [kilometres] a game‚Äù. Blair, his premiership teammate who arrived at the club a month after Sidebottom, said his endurance had set him apart from his peers. He remembered Sidebottom revealing to him at the start of their second season that he had gone for one five-kilometre run in the off-season as he felt guilty after a few consecutive days spent socialising. Steele Sidebottom and Jarryd Blair were front and centre in the 2010 premiership team. which contained eight players who started their careers on a rookie list. Credit: Paul Rovere ‚ÄúHe then won the 2k time trial in about 6:05 minutes,‚Äù Blair said. Blair said it‚Äôs one thing to have the endurance Sidebottom possessed but another to push the body to extremes to empty the tank. A competitive animal That will to always push harder came from an innate competitiveness that Blair has seen hilariously play out time after time, on and off the field. In their first year, the pair and another rookie, Tristan Francis, settled down for a game of cricket in the courtyard of their house in Williamstown. Three hours later, with Sidebottom still batting, his mates had had enough and went inside. ‚ÄúHe just straight batted it back like it was the fifth day of a Test match, and he was just trying to hang on,‚Äù Blair said. Loading That stubborn competitiveness is combined with a constant smile that his former coach Nathan Buckley calls the ‚Äúopposite of a resting bitch face‚Äù. The battles on the golf course between him and Jeremy Howe - two friends whose laid-back demeanour masks their desire to win - are famous at the club. ‚ÄúWhether it‚Äôs golf, table tennis, tennis, goal kicking, or an argument there is minimal chance you‚Äôre going to beat him with his relentless competitive drive,‚Äù Howe said. ‚ÄúBeing one of four brothers will create that within, I guess.‚Äù The smile is not just a facade. Sidebottom loves playing all sport, particularly football, and hanging out with his mates, his wife Alisha Edwards, who is a lawyer, and their daughter Matilda. His down-to-earth nature means 100 friends and family will be at Marvel Stadium on Sunday to watch him reach his milestone300th game, including his mum Linda, who Sidebottom bought a house for when his career took off to show his appreciation for her efforts raising five boys . ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs still the same old Steele he was when I met him 15-20 years ago,‚Äù Morey said. Muggleton laughs at his friend‚Äôs competitiveness, saying they often end some sort of sporting battle with a beer, unable to talk to each other about what transpired as one of them will still be seething. Left or right foot, it never mattered to Steele Sidebottom. Credit: Getty Images The pair played football together at Congupna, where Muggleton, a year older, was captain. Such was Sidebottom‚Äôs love of the club, which carries the nickname, ‚Äúthe Road‚Äù, he ended his Hotmail at one stage with ‚ÄúRoaders‚Äù. He might appear a country boy through and through, but he hasn‚Äôt fooled Muggleton. Loading ‚ÄúHe is scared of everything,‚Äù Muggleton said. He remembers taking Sidebottom fishing with his former teammate Adam Oxley, and Sidebottom yelling at them to pick up a fish that had dropped off the line after being caught. Muggleton finally said, ‚ÄúYou do it‚Äù, and watched Sidebottom retreat like a defeated army. ‚ÄúHe said, ‚ÄòNo way‚Äô,‚Äù Muggleton recalled. Blair adds that his mate was ‚Äúgenuinely petrified‚Äù of the ocean when he first moved to the club, never moving beyond his waist. He then taught himself to swim better. Such fears do not translate to the middle of the MCG, with Blair simply describing his friend‚Äôs record in big games as ‚Äúunreal‚Äù. Let me entertain you During his 299 matches, Sidebottom has played in front of 15,083,531 fans, with only teammate Scott Pendlebury and Essendon‚Äôs Dustin Fletcher showing their skills to more spectators. He won a flag in his second year, was runner-up in the Norm Smith Medal in the grand final replay behind Pendlebury, and after battling a bruised heel for several seasons midway through his career became a star during 2017 and 2018, earning All-Australian selection in 2018, was runner-up in a Brownlow Medal and became a dual Copeland Trophy winner. His 41-touch performance in the 2018 preliminary final is often forgotten due to Mason Cox‚Äôs heroics . He also won the 2016 Anzac Day Medal. He has been trouble free, apart from his COVID-19 breach in 2020 after a few drinks got out of hand. He served a four-game suspension and probably dashed any hopes he would replace Pendlebury as captain. Buckley, who was coach at the time, has enormous respect for him, as do all his teammates, with Sidebottom‚Äôs sense of humour often a ballast during difficult times at the club. ‚ÄúSteele keeps life relatively simple and then makes the difficult look ridiculously easy. He just loves being a part of the club and around the boys. He is just a balanced guy,‚Äù Buckley said. Blair played 144 games alongside Sidebottom, and knows his consistency is due to more than natural talent. Sidebottom said it would be wrong to say he is enjoying football more than ever under Craig McRae because he has always enjoyed it. Credit: Getty Images ‚ÄúHe has a deep level of care for what he is doing and pride in his performance. He has obviously always been a high achiever in sports and carried that through with him the whole way. His desperation to win has always been evident and cool to see and be a part of,‚Äù Blair said. He said his quiet leadership and the direction he has guided the club in should not be underestimated, either. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs not a confrontational person, but he has got a strong sense of right from wrong, and he is pretty comfortable in sticking to what he believes is right and the best thing for him and everyone at the club,‚Äù Blair said. Now, as just the fourth Magpie and the 101st player ever to reach 300 games, he is already confirmed as a club great. Not that anyone would recognise his status in the game if they bumped into him having a quiet beer with his mates, which is where he seems most comfortable. Magpies skipper Darcy Moore says his influence has been profound on and off the field. ‚ÄúHe is such a great teammate, so passionate and such a larrikin. He just never takes anything too seriously. He is always making jokes, and he is a really popular guy,‚Äù Moore said. But there is one thing Sidebottom is taking seriously, and that is Collingwood‚Äôs tilt at another premiership. Amid all the enjoyment, his focus on achieving that goal is at an all-time high. Keep up to date with the best AFL coverage in the country. Sign up for the Real Footy newsletter . newsArray.title: What Happens If IPL Final 2023 Between Gujarat Titans and Chennai Super Kings Gets Washed Out Due to Rain?
creator: admin
newsArray.description: Home Sports What Happens If IPL Final 2023 Between Gujarat Titans and Chennai Super Kings Gets Washed Out Due to Rain? The stage is all set for an epic clash as Gujarat are on the verge of becoming the first side after Chennai to retain the title in consecutive years. Chennai on the other hand [‚Ä¶] The post What Happens If IPL Final 2023 Between Gujarat Titans and Chennai Super Kings Gets Washed Out Due to Rain? first appeared on The Times of Bengal.
newsArray.content: New Delhi: Chennai Super Kings lock horns with defending champions Gujarat Titans in the 16th final of the Indian Premier League on Sunday at the Narendra Stadium in Ahmedabad. Rumours are also peaking high at the same time that this blockbuster finale will mark the end of CSK captain MS Dhoni‚Äôs cricketing career. The stage is all set for an epic clash as Gujarat are on the verge of becoming the first side after Chennai to retain the title in consecutive years. Chennai on the other hand will be fighting for Dhoni and make it equal with Mumbai on most trophies won. But what happens if the IPL Final gets washed out due to rain ? Even though there are less chances of rain in Ahmedabad and if not a single ball is bowled due to the harsh weather conditions, then one with the highest position in the table will run away with the trophy. In the case, Gujarat Titans will claim a second successive title as they topped the league phase ahead of Chennai Super Kings. A minimum of 5 overs need to be bowled for a match to take place. If the match gets stopped in between the play then quite obviously Duckworth-Lewis (DLS) method will come into play to determine the winner. Gujarat Titans Squad: Wriddhiman Saha(w), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya(c), Vijay Shankar, David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Mohit Sharma, Noor Ahmad, Mohammed Shami, Joshua Little, Srikar Bharat, Shivam Mavi, Odean Smith, Ravisrinivasan Sai Kishore, Pradeep Sangwan, Matthew Wade, Jayant Yadav, Dasun Shanaka, Abhinav Manohar, Alzarri Joseph, Darshan Nalkande, Urvil Patel, Yash Dayal. Chennai Super Kings Squad: Ruturaj Gaikwad, Devon Conway, Shivam Dube, Ajinkya Rahane, Ambati Rayudu, MS Dhoni(w/c), Ravindra Jadeja, Moeen Ali, Deepak Chahar, Tushar Deshpande, Maheesh Theekshana, Matheesha Pathirana, Mitchell Santner, Subhranshu Senapati, Shaik Rasheed, Akash Singh, Ben Stokes, Dwaine Pretorius, Sisanda Magala, Ajay Jadav Mandal, Prashant Solanki, Simarjeet Singh, RS Hangargekar, Bhagath Varma, Nishant Sindhu. $(document).ready(function(){ $('#commentbtn').on("click",function(){ (function(d, s, id) { var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0]; if (d.getElementById(id)) return; js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id; js.src = "https://connect.facebook.net/en_US/all.js#xfbml=1&appId=178196885542208"; fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs); }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk')); $(".cmntbox").toggle(); }); }); Source link

newsArray.title: Bayern sack CEO Oliver Kahn, sports director Hasan Salihamidzic after title win-club
newsArray.content: Bayern Munich have parted ways with club CEO Oliver Kahn and Hasan Salihamidzic only minutes after they snatched their 11th straight Bundesliga title on the last matchday on Saturday, the club said. Kahn, who took over the position in 2021 succeeding Karl-Heinz Rummenigge, will be replaced by Jan-Christian Dreesen with immediate effect, the club said in a statement. ‚ÄúIt was a difficult decision to part ways with Oliver but we came to the conclusion that based on the overall development a restaffing of the top position in the board,‚Äù Bayern said. Bayern beat Cologne 2-1 thanks to an 89th minute winner from Jamal Musiala and benefited from Borussia Dortmund‚Äôs 2-2 draw to win the title on goal difference. newsArray.title: IPL 2023: Chennai Super Kings better prepared for IPL final compared to past, says Stephen Fleming
newsArray.content: Chennai Super Kings head coach Stephen Fleming on Saturday said that the four-time winners are better prepared for the IPL final against Gujarat Titans than any other time in the past, when conditions affected their performance. Fleming said CSK‚Äôs win-loss ratio remained around 50 per cent because they would usually build and prepare their squads keeping the conditions and pitches at the home venue at Chepauk in mind, but that is not the case anymore. He said the team would be ready for any conditions ‚Äî there are rains expected during the final here on Sunday ‚Äî and that they have erred in reading conditions and pitches in the past. ‚ÄúWe geared ourselves up so well for Chennai that we did struggle with conditions at times in away games, so the finals were always a little bit of a challenge, and our record is about 50 per cent of winning the final,‚Äù Fleming said during the pre-match press conference. ‚ÄúIt is maybe due to the style of the game we created ‚Äî a victim of being so good at home that we had to make adjustments when we went to a neutral venue.‚Äù Fleming said CSK were ‚Äúa bit more rounded‚Äù this year. ‚ÄúBecause of that going back to Chennai (for Qualifier 1), it was hard. I wanted to bowl (first) in the last qualifying game and batting proved to be the right call and MS (Dhoni) was the other way in the last game,‚Äù he said. Anbuden ‚û°Ô∏è Ahmedabad with a million whistles! ü•≥ #GTvCSK #WhistlePodu #Yellove ü¶Åüíõ pic.twitter.com/Tyjhxd1Nsf ‚Äî Chennai Super Kings (@ChennaiIPL) May 23, 2023 https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js ‚ÄúSo we are well off the mark in trying to get the conditions right but the team is rounded enough to put performances together. Come the final, we are not worried as to what conditions we get, there are two pitches to choose from now but we are not too worried. We are a lot better placed than what we had been in the past,‚Äù he said. Advertisement The former New Zealand captain said that making early breakthroughs will be key for his side as GT batter Shubman Gill‚Äôs red-hot form presents the biggest challenge for CSK. ‚ÄúHe (Gill) is playing really well. It (the plans) does not really change, you hope that you pick him up early, you have enough firepower to create an opportunity. The only thing that we are looking at is when you have got openers, when they are in such good form, there is an opportunity to get into the middle order. Advertisement ‚ÄúIf we can get a couple of early breakthroughs then, (just like) in the last game we played there is an opportunity. But we got to get past him, he is playing really well,‚Äù Fleming said. For someone who has won IPL title four times with CSK, Fleming said it is not easy winning the trophy back-to-back. ‚ÄúSo hard! It is impossible, it is going to be so hard for them (GT) to do it (laughs). No, they are a good side; you got to say ‚Äòreally well done‚Äô to what they have put together in a short space of time,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI like the coaching staff a lot, they are really balanced guys. Ashish, for all his talking, has got a really good grasp of the game, his enthusiasm is really high after working with him in Chennai. We have a huge amount of respect for what they have done but it is very hard to go back to back.‚Äù Gujarat Titans ‚Äô team director Vikram Solanki also returned the favour, but added that knowledge of conditions in their ‚Äòhome ground‚Äô here should hold them in good stead. ‚ÄúWe are definitely better for the experience for having played here, having played in the final (last year) here, and having been successful in those big games. We are better for it,‚Äù he said. Caution: Wear helmets and watch Shivam drive! ü¶Åüí• #WhistlePodu #Yellove üíõ @IamShivamDube pic.twitter.com/dfdIK9fXLQ ‚Äî Chennai Super Kings (@ChennaiIPL) May 27, 2023 https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js Advertisement ‚ÄúWe entirely appreciate this sort of respect CSK have given. They have been a fabulous team for a good number of years now and we respect that. We are confident; what transpires on the day is what transpires on the day,‚Äù Solanki added. Solanki praised GT‚Äôs bowling trio of Mohammad Shami (28 wickets), Rashid Khan (27 wickets) and Mohit Sharma (24 wickets), who also are the top three wicket-takers in this IPL. Advertisement ‚ÄúIf you look at the tournament in its entirety, the impact player rule has had a bearing on the number of batsmen that are playing, therefore, wicket-taking becomes all the more important. We have always being attacking minded, an attack that is able to take wickets in different conditions through different phases of the game,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThat is our go-to, the ability to take wickets. All three have been quite brilliant this year, they have worked extremely hard and they deserve all the success that is coming their way.‚Äù The former England batter said at just 23, Gill could be an example for young batters to model their batting on. Advertisement Top Sports News Now The Shubman Gill nullifier: What makes Deepak Chahar MS Dhoni's favorite Prithvi Shaw thinks he's a star, should learn from Shubman Gill and must work on his technique and fitness: Karsan Ghavri 'Shubman is the next superstar of world cricket': Karsan Ghavri recalls when he nurtured an 11-yr-old Gill Click here for more ‚ÄúFor a young man, he is quite a brilliant technician as far as batting is concerned. He would certainly be one of the examples that you would like to use for young players on how to bat,‚Äù Solanki said. Also Read For CSK, Dhoni is a habit, he isn't retiring any time soon Prithvi Shaw thinks he's a star, should learn from Shubman Gill and must ... Sometimes Virat celebrates more than the bowlers, says Anushka Sharma Now we are sure that Malli is in safe hands: MS Dhoni meets Matheesha Pat... ‚ÄúHe has all of the qualities of a world-class player and he is just showing his skill level. Fortunately for us, he is in good form, he works very hard on his game, not just in practice. He is very conscious of the opposition that he is going to face, where he is likely to gain advantage, what are the dangers, what are the things that he is going to have to deal with.‚Äù

newsArray.title: ‚ÄúHello friend, we meet again‚Äù: Jasprit Bumrah hints at international cricket return
creator: ANI
newsArray.content: Indian pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah, who has been out of action for the last several months due to injury, seems to be on the path of a stunning comeback to the sport. The 29-year-old pacer posted a picture of his cricket shoes on his Instagram. ‚ÄúHello friend, we meet again,‚Äù said Bumrah‚Äôs post caption. https://www.instagram.com/p/CsvzrL-KHuq/?hl=en In April, Bumrah underwent surgery on his lower back in New Zealand. The medical procedure was successful and helped Bumrah get free from pain. ‚ÄúJasprit Bumrah underwent surgery on his lower back in New Zealand which was successful and he remains pain-free. The fast bowler was advised by the specialist to start his rehab six weeks after the surgery and accordingly, Bumrah commenced his rehab management at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru from Friday,‚Äù said a press release from BCCI on April 15. Bumrah is out of action since September 2022 owing to a back injury and as a result, missed the ICC Men‚Äôs T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. The ace pacer completed his rehabilitation at the National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru and has been seen bowling in the nets but BCCI has chosen not to rush him back into action. The pacer also missed Indian Premier League (2023), in which he represents Mumbai Indians. Though MI reached playoffs, their bowling attack looked extremely toothless without Bumrah‚Äôs presence on numerous occasions. While fans wait to see Bumrah back on the field with his unique bowling action, he has been unable to join the team due to a recurring injury. He has attempted to make a comeback more than once since suffering a back injury in August last year which ruled him out of the Asia Cup. Initially, the injury did not seem serious as he was named in India‚Äôs T20 World Cup squad in September and even played the last two T20Is against Australia on September 23 and September 25 last year. Three days later, Bumrah did not play the first T20I against South Africa and it was learnt that he was taken for scans, which revealed a stress-related injury in his back. He was rushed to NCA and the scans there confirmed that the injury was serious. It ruled him out of the T20 World Cup, in which India achieved a semifinal finish. Bumrah resumed his rehab in November and started to bowl in mid-December. His progress seemed to be positive as he was added to the white-ball series played in January against Sri Lanka more than a week after the original squad was picked up. Bumrah had performed the match simulation exercises in the NCA, but discomfort resurfaced while taking up higher workloads during fitness drills in January. Scans revealed the development of a fresh niggle, which ruled him out of the Sri Lanka series and Border-Gavaskar Trophy against Australia. (ANI)

newsArray.title: When Gautam Gambhir Kicked Chair in Frustration Post KKR Win vs RCB in IPL 2016
creator: Gurpreet Singh
newsArray.description: Be it in the capacity of a player or in his role as the mentor of Lucknow Super Giants at present, Gautam Gambhir has made sure to not shy away from displaying his raw emotions to the ever-ready cameras panning towards him. His temperature perhaps soars higher by a couple of notches whenever he is‚Ä¶ The post When Gautam Gambhir Kicked Chair in Frustration Post KKR Win vs RCB in IPL 2016 appeared first on The SportsRush.
newsArray.content: Be it in the capacity of a player or in his role as the mentor of at present, has made sure to not shy away from displaying his raw emotions to the ever-ready cameras panning towards him. Advertisement His temperature perhaps soars higher by a couple of notches whenever he is involved in an IPL fixture featuring former captain because of some past moments of uneasy tension between the two . During the 2016 edition of the coveted league, Gambhir had yet again indulged himself in an act which was not only unnecessary but had resultantly cost him 15% of match fee owing to unruly behavior. Advertisement En route a 186-run targetagainst RCB in Bengaluru, Gambhir-led had lost four wickets by the 11th over of the chase. However, the pair of (60*) and (39) nailed their respective power game to see their side home with five deliveries to spare. The moment (10*) smashed the winning boundary, a pumped-up Gambhir could not control his emotions and vented his frustration by kicking a chair placed in the dug out across the boundary rope. The southpaw batter, who was still with his pads on, was more than just excited with the way his team snatched victory from the jaws of defeat. Post kicking the chair, he perhaps also hurled a couple of expletives while looking at someone in the field of play. Loading embed instagram https://www.instagram.com/reel/CslGQYNNmrB/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading After being fined with the Level 1 breach of the IPL code of conduct, the KKR skipper did accept his mistake while realizing that he shouldn‚Äôt have kicked the chair. Advertisement However, he was later quoted as saying by that despite being a role model, he, too, is entitled to have emotions and feelings which get naturally displayed on the field of action. ‚ÄúMy brush with the authorities is not new. While I am repentant and embarrassed, I have never got the answer to one very basic question ‚Äì Aren‚Äôt role models entitled to have emotions? Aren‚Äôt they human enough to express themselves or release their pent-up feelings? I think they, too, are by-products of the times and the society they are living in.‚Äù Eyeing on his third IPL title, Gambhir did manage to take KKR through to the playoffs that season by finishing at the fourth spot on the points table post the league stage. However, Kolkata ended up losing to by 22 runs in the Eliminator to crash out of the tournament. Advertisement

newsArray.title: ‚ÄòHe tells everyone, please keep watching me‚Äô: S Badrinath reveals how MS Dhoni‚Äôs last moment field changes produce wickets
newsArray.content: Former Chennai Super Kings player Subramaniam Badrinath revealed how skipper Mahendra Singh Dhoni tends to make maneuvers in the last moment before every delivery and occasionally they end up producing wickets. Speaking on Star Sports, Badrinath said, ‚ÄúHe tells everyone, please keep watching me. Because that last minute adjustment, that two yard left or right could be the difference between a catch and a drop. It has happened many times.‚Äù ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs important that we keep tuned into the game, and try to remain involved. Every ball is an event, and we complete the event and move onto the next event. That‚Äôs how he addresses every ball. He assures the field is right, the bowler is right,‚Äù he added. In response to a query about Dhoni‚Äôs conversation with the team in the 2010 final Badrinath said, ‚ÄúEvery time there was a par total, and not so much of a par, he only said one thing; let‚Äôs try and save one run each.‚Äù ‚ÄúIf we save a run each, we can make the score 10 runs extra. That‚Äôs what was going to be the difference, because these were under our control. Wickets will happen, but the small things; if everybody is trying to save one run, the score becomes a little extra,‚Äù he added. newsArray.title: Can play in front of millions, but was once ‚Äòpetrified‚Äô of the ocean
creator: Peter Ryan
newsArray.description: Pies stalwart Steele Sidebottom plays his 300th game on Sunday, and his close friends and teammates have shared their stories of a laid-back, fun-loving, competitive beast.
newsArray.content: Loading Collingwood‚Äôs Steele Sidebottom has never been one to pump himself up. Nor has he chased the limelight. But he could not resist interrupting his premiership skipper Nick Maxwell - who had joined the club as a rookie - during a pre-season session where the captain emphasised to the club‚Äôs recruits that regardless of what number pick they had been when they arrived, they were all equally entitled to play in round one. Collingwood‚Äôs Steele Sidebottom, who reaches 300 AFL games on Sunday, with the statue of Bob Rose. Credit: Getty Images Maxwell extolled the virtues of his rookie brethren, praising them for their persistence and resilience and making it pretty obvious he had a soft spot for footy‚Äôs battlers. The speech became all a bit rich for Sidebottom. ‚ÄúSorry for being a gun and kicking 10 in a granny,‚Äù Sidebottom suddenly blurted out. The room dissolved into laughter. Premiership player Steele Sidebottom is one of the constants between the 2010 and 2023 sides. Credit: Getty Images That bag of 10 for the Murray Bushrangers in the 2008 TAC Cup grand final ensured he was a first-round pick, Collingwood using selection 11 to make him a Magpie. It was the first thing his new teammates heard about him. Soon enough, however, they were talking about his constant smile, his skills on both sides of his body and his clean hands, and his competitiveness. ‚ÄúHe is realistically one of the most competitive people I have ever met,‚Äù said Jarryd Blair, the former Pie who also joined the club as a rookie, and who remains one of Sidebottom‚Äôs great mates. His friend Sam Muggleton told The Age that Sidebottom had been ‚Äúa gun‚Äù from the moment they first played together as primary school children in a combined team from Shepparton. Celebrate if you‚Äôve kicked 10 goals in a TAC Cup grand final: Steele Sidebottom can. Credit: Getty Images At Sidebottom‚Äôs wedding in 2022, Muggleton recalled in his speech a bloke with a rat‚Äôs tail rocking up to training for that team late in the piece and being picked immediately. Their first game was tight before Sidebottom stepped up to kick one goal with his left foot from the right forward pocket, and then the winning goal with his right foot from the left forward pocket. He had learned to kick on both feet because he idolised his older brother Tyson - who he cheekily described on Wednesday as the favourite of his four older brothers - who was proficient on both feet. Sidebottom spent hours booting a footy into the back fence, alternating feet to keep it interesting. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve always had some kind of ball in my hand. I played touch footy, soccer, cricket, tennis, whatever it is,‚Äù Sidebottom said. The endurance beast Another of his mates from around Shepparton, Michael Morey, knew his friend‚Äôs ball skills were good, but it wasn‚Äôt until they were in their teens he realised he had other athletic attributes. The pair had faced off in Morey‚Äôs family orchard with three small apples in their hands to ping at each other. Morey moved first, but each throw missed. He had to run. Loading Soon after he took off, he felt Sidebottom‚Äôs breath on his neck despite the fact he was sprinting to get away. ‚ÄúHe just slowly sat behind me for the next 500 metres and as soon as I started puffing a little bit, bang, apple in the back of the head. He got all three into me and I remember thinking, ‚ÄòThis guy can run‚Äô,‚Äù Morey said. Close to 20 years after that horseplay revealed his tank, Sidebottom is still covering more ground during matches than all but one or two of his teammates, reaching ‚Äúanywhere from 13 to 15 [kilometres] a game‚Äù. Blair, his premiership teammate who arrived at the club a month after Sidebottom, said his endurance had set him apart from his peers. He remembered Sidebottom revealing to him at the start of their second season that he had gone for one five-kilometre run in the off-season as he felt guilty after a few consecutive days spent socialising. Steele Sidebottom and Jarryd Blair were front and centre in the 2010 premiership team. which contained eight players who started their careers on a rookie list. Credit: Paul Rovere ‚ÄúHe then won the 2k time trial in about 6:05 minutes,‚Äù Blair said. Blair said it‚Äôs one thing to have the endurance Sidebottom possessed but another to push the body to extremes to empty the tank. A competitive animal That will to always push harder came from an innate competitiveness that Blair has seen hilariously play out time after time, on and off the field. In their first year, the pair and another rookie, Tristan Francis, settled down for a game of cricket in the courtyard of their house in Williamstown. Three hours later, with Sidebottom still batting, his mates had had enough and went inside. ‚ÄúHe just straight batted it back like it was the fifth day of a Test match, and he was just trying to hang on,‚Äù Blair said. Loading That stubborn competitiveness is combined with a constant smile that his former coach Nathan Buckley calls the ‚Äúopposite of a resting bitch face‚Äù. The battles on the golf course between him and Jeremy Howe - two friends whose laid-back demeanour masks their desire to win - are famous at the club. ‚ÄúWhether it‚Äôs golf, table tennis, tennis, goal kicking, or an argument there is minimal chance you‚Äôre going to beat him with his relentless competitive drive,‚Äù Howe said. ‚ÄúBeing one of four brothers will create that within, I guess.‚Äù The smile is not just a facade. Sidebottom loves playing all sport, particularly football, and hanging out with his mates, his wife Alisha Edwards, who is a lawyer, and their daughter Matilda. His down-to-earth nature means 100 friends and family will be at Marvel Stadium on Sunday to watch him reach his milestone300th game, including his mum Linda, who Sidebottom bought a house for when his career took off to show his appreciation for her efforts raising five boys . ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs still the same old Steele he was when I met him 15-20 years ago,‚Äù Morey said. Muggleton laughs at his friend‚Äôs competitiveness, saying they often end some sort of sporting battle with a beer, unable to talk to each other about what transpired as one of them will still be seething. Left or right foot, it never mattered to Steele Sidebottom. Credit: Getty Images The pair played football together at Congupna, where Muggleton, a year older, was captain. Such was Sidebottom‚Äôs love of the club, which carries the nickname, ‚Äúthe Road‚Äù, he ended his Hotmail at one stage with ‚ÄúRoaders‚Äù. He might appear a country boy through and through, but he hasn‚Äôt fooled Muggleton. Loading ‚ÄúHe is scared of everything,‚Äù Muggleton said. He remembers taking Sidebottom fishing with his former teammate Adam Oxley, and Sidebottom yelling at them to pick up a fish that had dropped off the line after being caught. Muggleton finally said, ‚ÄúYou do it‚Äù, and watched Sidebottom retreat like a defeated army. ‚ÄúHe said, ‚ÄòNo way‚Äô,‚Äù Muggleton recalled. Blair adds that his mate was ‚Äúgenuinely petrified‚Äù of the ocean when he first moved to the club, never moving beyond his waist. He then taught himself to swim better. Such fears do not translate to the middle of the MCG, with Blair simply describing his friend‚Äôs record in big games as ‚Äúunreal‚Äù. Let me entertain you During his 299 matches, Sidebottom has played in front of 15,083,531 fans, with only teammate Scott Pendlebury and Essendon‚Äôs Dustin Fletcher showing their skills to more spectators. He won a flag in his second year, was runner-up in the Norm Smith Medal in the grand final replay behind Pendlebury, and after battling a bruised heel for several seasons midway through his career became a star during 2017 and 2018, earning All-Australian selection in 2018, was runner-up in a Brownlow Medal and became a dual Copeland Trophy winner. His 41-touch performance in the 2018 preliminary final is often forgotten due to Mason Cox‚Äôs heroics . He also won the 2016 Anzac Day Medal. He has been trouble free, apart from his COVID-19 breach in 2020 after a few drinks got out of hand. He served a four-game suspension and probably dashed any hopes he would replace Pendlebury as captain. Buckley, who was coach at the time, has enormous respect for him, as do all his teammates, with Sidebottom‚Äôs sense of humour often a ballast during difficult times at the club. ‚ÄúSteele keeps life relatively simple and then makes the difficult look ridiculously easy. He just loves being a part of the club and around the boys. He is just a balanced guy,‚Äù Buckley said. Blair played 144 games alongside Sidebottom, and knows his consistency is due to more than natural talent. Sidebottom said it would be wrong to say he is enjoying football more than ever under Craig McRae because he has always enjoyed it. Credit: Getty Images ‚ÄúHe has a deep level of care for what he is doing and pride in his performance. He has obviously always been a high achiever in sports and carried that through with him the whole way. His desperation to win has always been evident and cool to see and be a part of,‚Äù Blair said. He said his quiet leadership and the direction he has guided the club in should not be underestimated, either. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs not a confrontational person, but he has got a strong sense of right from wrong, and he is pretty comfortable in sticking to what he believes is right and the best thing for him and everyone at the club,‚Äù Blair said. Now, as just the fourth Magpie and the 101st player ever to reach 300 games, he is already confirmed as a club great. Not that anyone would recognise his status in the game if they bumped into him having a quiet beer with his mates, which is where he seems most comfortable. Magpies skipper Darcy Moore says his influence has been profound on and off the field. ‚ÄúHe is such a great teammate, so passionate and such a larrikin. He just never takes anything too seriously. He is always making jokes, and he is a really popular guy,‚Äù Moore said. But there is one thing Sidebottom is taking seriously, and that is Collingwood‚Äôs tilt at another premiership. Amid all the enjoyment, his focus on achieving that goal is at an all-time high. Keep up to date with the best AFL coverage in the country. Sign up for the Real Footy newsletter . newsArray.title: What Happens If IPL Final 2023 Between Gujarat Titans and Chennai Super Kings Gets Washed Out Due to Rain?
creator: admin
newsArray.description: Home Sports What Happens If IPL Final 2023 Between Gujarat Titans and Chennai Super Kings Gets Washed Out Due to Rain? The stage is all set for an epic clash as Gujarat are on the verge of becoming the first side after Chennai to retain the title in consecutive years. Chennai on the other hand [‚Ä¶] The post What Happens If IPL Final 2023 Between Gujarat Titans and Chennai Super Kings Gets Washed Out Due to Rain? first appeared on The Times of Bengal.
newsArray.content: New Delhi: Chennai Super Kings lock horns with defending champions Gujarat Titans in the 16th final of the Indian Premier League on Sunday at the Narendra Stadium in Ahmedabad. Rumours are also peaking high at the same time that this blockbuster finale will mark the end of CSK captain MS Dhoni‚Äôs cricketing career. The stage is all set for an epic clash as Gujarat are on the verge of becoming the first side after Chennai to retain the title in consecutive years. Chennai on the other hand will be fighting for Dhoni and make it equal with Mumbai on most trophies won. But what happens if the IPL Final gets washed out due to rain ? Even though there are less chances of rain in Ahmedabad and if not a single ball is bowled due to the harsh weather conditions, then one with the highest position in the table will run away with the trophy. In the case, Gujarat Titans will claim a second successive title as they topped the league phase ahead of Chennai Super Kings. A minimum of 5 overs need to be bowled for a match to take place. If the match gets stopped in between the play then quite obviously Duckworth-Lewis (DLS) method will come into play to determine the winner. Gujarat Titans Squad: Wriddhiman Saha(w), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya(c), Vijay Shankar, David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Mohit Sharma, Noor Ahmad, Mohammed Shami, Joshua Little, Srikar Bharat, Shivam Mavi, Odean Smith, Ravisrinivasan Sai Kishore, Pradeep Sangwan, Matthew Wade, Jayant Yadav, Dasun Shanaka, Abhinav Manohar, Alzarri Joseph, Darshan Nalkande, Urvil Patel, Yash Dayal. Chennai Super Kings Squad: Ruturaj Gaikwad, Devon Conway, Shivam Dube, Ajinkya Rahane, Ambati Rayudu, MS Dhoni(w/c), Ravindra Jadeja, Moeen Ali, Deepak Chahar, Tushar Deshpande, Maheesh Theekshana, Matheesha Pathirana, Mitchell Santner, Subhranshu Senapati, Shaik Rasheed, Akash Singh, Ben Stokes, Dwaine Pretorius, Sisanda Magala, Ajay Jadav Mandal, Prashant Solanki, Simarjeet Singh, RS Hangargekar, Bhagath Varma, Nishant Sindhu. $(document).ready(function(){ $('#commentbtn').on("click",function(){ (function(d, s, id) { var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0]; if (d.getElementById(id)) return; js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id; js.src = "https://connect.facebook.net/en_US/all.js#xfbml=1&appId=178196885542208"; fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs); }(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk')); $(".cmntbox").toggle(); }); }); Source link

newsArray.title: Bayern sack CEO Oliver Kahn, sports director Hasan Salihamidzic after title win-club
newsArray.content: Bayern Munich have parted ways with club CEO Oliver Kahn and Hasan Salihamidzic only minutes after they snatched their 11th straight Bundesliga title on the last matchday on Saturday, the club said. Kahn, who took over the position in 2021 succeeding Karl-Heinz Rummenigge, will be replaced by Jan-Christian Dreesen with immediate effect, the club said in a statement. ‚ÄúIt was a difficult decision to part ways with Oliver but we came to the conclusion that based on the overall development a restaffing of the top position in the board,‚Äù Bayern said. Bayern beat Cologne 2-1 thanks to an 89th minute winner from Jamal Musiala and benefited from Borussia Dortmund‚Äôs 2-2 draw to win the title on goal difference. newsArray.title: IPL 2023: Chennai Super Kings better prepared for IPL final compared to past, says Stephen Fleming
newsArray.content: Chennai Super Kings head coach Stephen Fleming on Saturday said that the four-time winners are better prepared for the IPL final against Gujarat Titans than any other time in the past, when conditions affected their performance. Fleming said CSK‚Äôs win-loss ratio remained around 50 per cent because they would usually build and prepare their squads keeping the conditions and pitches at the home venue at Chepauk in mind, but that is not the case anymore. He said the team would be ready for any conditions ‚Äî there are rains expected during the final here on Sunday ‚Äî and that they have erred in reading conditions and pitches in the past. ‚ÄúWe geared ourselves up so well for Chennai that we did struggle with conditions at times in away games, so the finals were always a little bit of a challenge, and our record is about 50 per cent of winning the final,‚Äù Fleming said during the pre-match press conference. ‚ÄúIt is maybe due to the style of the game we created ‚Äî a victim of being so good at home that we had to make adjustments when we went to a neutral venue.‚Äù Fleming said CSK were ‚Äúa bit more rounded‚Äù this year. ‚ÄúBecause of that going back to Chennai (for Qualifier 1), it was hard. I wanted to bowl (first) in the last qualifying game and batting proved to be the right call and MS (Dhoni) was the other way in the last game,‚Äù he said. Anbuden ‚û°Ô∏è Ahmedabad with a million whistles! ü•≥ #GTvCSK #WhistlePodu #Yellove ü¶Åüíõ pic.twitter.com/Tyjhxd1Nsf ‚Äî Chennai Super Kings (@ChennaiIPL) May 23, 2023 https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js ‚ÄúSo we are well off the mark in trying to get the conditions right but the team is rounded enough to put performances together. Come the final, we are not worried as to what conditions we get, there are two pitches to choose from now but we are not too worried. We are a lot better placed than what we had been in the past,‚Äù he said. Advertisement The former New Zealand captain said that making early breakthroughs will be key for his side as GT batter Shubman Gill‚Äôs red-hot form presents the biggest challenge for CSK. ‚ÄúHe (Gill) is playing really well. It (the plans) does not really change, you hope that you pick him up early, you have enough firepower to create an opportunity. The only thing that we are looking at is when you have got openers, when they are in such good form, there is an opportunity to get into the middle order. Advertisement ‚ÄúIf we can get a couple of early breakthroughs then, (just like) in the last game we played there is an opportunity. But we got to get past him, he is playing really well,‚Äù Fleming said. For someone who has won IPL title four times with CSK, Fleming said it is not easy winning the trophy back-to-back. ‚ÄúSo hard! It is impossible, it is going to be so hard for them (GT) to do it (laughs). No, they are a good side; you got to say ‚Äòreally well done‚Äô to what they have put together in a short space of time,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI like the coaching staff a lot, they are really balanced guys. Ashish, for all his talking, has got a really good grasp of the game, his enthusiasm is really high after working with him in Chennai. We have a huge amount of respect for what they have done but it is very hard to go back to back.‚Äù Gujarat Titans ‚Äô team director Vikram Solanki also returned the favour, but added that knowledge of conditions in their ‚Äòhome ground‚Äô here should hold them in good stead. ‚ÄúWe are definitely better for the experience for having played here, having played in the final (last year) here, and having been successful in those big games. We are better for it,‚Äù he said. Caution: Wear helmets and watch Shivam drive! ü¶Åüí• #WhistlePodu #Yellove üíõ @IamShivamDube pic.twitter.com/dfdIK9fXLQ ‚Äî Chennai Super Kings (@ChennaiIPL) May 27, 2023 https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js Advertisement ‚ÄúWe entirely appreciate this sort of respect CSK have given. They have been a fabulous team for a good number of years now and we respect that. We are confident; what transpires on the day is what transpires on the day,‚Äù Solanki added. Solanki praised GT‚Äôs bowling trio of Mohammad Shami (28 wickets), Rashid Khan (27 wickets) and Mohit Sharma (24 wickets), who also are the top three wicket-takers in this IPL. Advertisement ‚ÄúIf you look at the tournament in its entirety, the impact player rule has had a bearing on the number of batsmen that are playing, therefore, wicket-taking becomes all the more important. We have always being attacking minded, an attack that is able to take wickets in different conditions through different phases of the game,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThat is our go-to, the ability to take wickets. All three have been quite brilliant this year, they have worked extremely hard and they deserve all the success that is coming their way.‚Äù The former England batter said at just 23, Gill could be an example for young batters to model their batting on. He would certainly be one of the examples that you would like to use for young players on how to bat,‚Äù Solanki said.
